Violation_Type: Failure to meet residency requirement for citizenship
Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in law by ignoring or misconstruing evidence regarding the applicant's residency
Application_Facts: Applicant's passive indicators of residence, low income, medical visits, tenancy agreements, and laser treatment schedule were questioned
No direct contradictions in evidence presented
Decision_Outcome: Denial of citizenship application due to perceived insufficient evidence of residency
Remedy_Requested: Allow appeal and refer case for reassessment
Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; case referred to another Citizenship Judge
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge failed to properly address key evidence during interview
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision based on irrelevant or erroneous reasons
Procedural_Issue: Failure to address evidence with applicant during interview
Credibility_Assessment: Judge questioned credibility without adequate basis or opportunity for applicant response
Legal_Provision_Cited: Citizenship Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. C-29 - Residency requirement
Application_Basis: Proof of physical residency in Canada for citizenship eligibility
Relief_Sought: Reassessment of application by a different Citizenship Judge
Governing_Rule: Residency requirement under the Citizenship Act must be met with credible evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of direct contradiction in evidence; insufficient probing during interview
Outcome: Appeal allowed; remitted for new assessment
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to flawed evaluation process
Cause_Description: Citizenship application denied based on unreasonable interpretation of residency evidence
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient engagement with applicant on key evidence during interview
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section of Citizenship Act relating to residency obligation for naturalization
Evidence_Issues: Failure to clarify ambiguous evidence with applicant
Residency_Compliance: Alleged non-compliance with physical residency requirement
Evidence_Assessment: Judge relied on speculative concerns without supporting evidence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was unreasonable due to reliance on irrelevant or unsubstantiated factors
Evidentiary_Issues: Inadequate examination of residency indicators during interview
